Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Weibo and Twitter that claim it shows people who committed suicide in the U.S. after contracting COVID-19.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video was published in 2014 news reports about a group of migrants who died after a boat sank off the coast of Libya.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed tens of thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Weibo and Twitter that claim it shows people who committed suicide in the U.S. after contracting COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video was published in 2014 news reports about a group of migrants who died after a boat sank off the coast of Libya.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-first-appeared-2014-reports-about-migrants-who-drowned-libyan-coast

Claim: A video shows the cause of COVID-19.
Explaination: The video has circulated online since at least July 2011 and actually shows repairs being made to the roof of a bat-infested house in the city of Miami in the United States.
Label: False

Claim: A video shows the cause of COVID-19.

Claim: “Boil some orange peels with cayenne pepper, stand over the pot, breathe in the steam so all mucus can be released from your nasal passages … Mucus is the problem, it’s where the virus lives!”
Explaination: Orange peels and cayenne are not proven to treat COVID-19, and neither is boiling them.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: “Boil some orange peels with cayenne pepper, stand over the pot, breathe in the steam so all mucus can be released from your nasal passages … Mucus is the problem, it’s where the virus lives!”

Explanation:Orange peels and cayenne are not proven to treat COVID-19, and neither is boiling them.

Claim: A viral video showing some men assaulting a policeman is being shared with the claim that it is from Agripada, Mumbai (Indiaa).
Explaination: Our investigation revealed that the video is from Banglore, not Mumbai. Two men were arrested for attacking two constables after they were stopped for breaching a check post set up to implement the lockdown in Sanjay Nagar of Banglore.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A viral video showing some men assaulting a policeman is being shared with the claim that it is from Agripada, Mumbai (Indiaa).

Explanation:Our investigation revealed that the video is from Banglore, not Mumbai. Two men were arrested for attacking two constables after they were stopped for breaching a check post set up to implement the lockdown in Sanjay Nagar of Banglore.

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/video-of-men-assaulting-cops-in-bangalore-shared-as-from-mumbai/

Claim: The United States is “actually screening fewer people (for the coronavirus than other countries) because we don’t have appropriate testing.”
Explaination: The CDC has stopped publicly reporting the number of tests it’s administered. As of March 4, the United States has lagged behind other nations in terms of coronavirus testing.
Label: MOSTLY TRUE
html:
Claim: The United States is “actually screening fewer people (for the coronavirus than other countries) because we don’t have appropriate testing.”

Claim: CDC recommends men shave their beards to be protected against the new coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is based on a Centers for Disease Control chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing "filtering facepiece respirators" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: CDC recommends men shave their beards to be protected against the new coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is based on a Centers for Disease Control chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing "filtering facepiece respirators" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of coronavirus.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471784-fact-check-cdc-did-not-recommend-men-shave-their-beards-to-protect-against-coronavirus.html

Claim: A picture claims that an Italian man committed suicide after his whole family succumbed to COVID-19
Explaination: The image is of a woman committing suicide in Spain in December 2019. BOOM could not establish what drove the woman to take such a step.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A picture claims that an Italian man committed suicide after his whole family succumbed to COVID-19

Explanation:The image is of a woman committing suicide in Spain in December 2019. BOOM could not establish what drove the woman to take such a step.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/dated-photos-of-a-suicide-in-spain-falsely-linked-to-coronavirus-in-italy-7370

Claim: Coronavirus contains “HIV insertions.”
Explaination: This claim is based on a study which compared extremely short protein sequences between the 2019 novel coronavirus and HIV, a practice likely to give false positives. The study’s authors also overlooked checking for potential similarities between 2019-nCoV and other organisms. As it turned out, these short protein sequences were similar to many other organisms, not just HIV, thereby refuting the claim that 2019-nCoV contains DNA from the HIV virus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus contains “HIV insertions.”

Explanation:This claim is based on a study which compared extremely short protein sequences between the 2019 novel coronavirus and HIV, a practice likely to give false positives. The study’s authors also overlooked checking for potential similarities between 2019-nCoV and other organisms. As it turned out, these short protein sequences were similar to many other organisms, not just HIV, thereby refuting the claim that 2019-nCoV contains DNA from the HIV virus.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/no-hiv-insertions-were-not-identified-in-the-2019-coronavirus-contrary-to-claims-based-on-questionable-bioinformatics-study/

Claim: Italy’s president was caught on camera crying over and regretting country’s coronavirus response.
Explaination: The man in the video is not even Italy's president. It was an older video of Brazil's president at a Thanksgiving service.
Label: False
html:

Explanation:The man in the video is not even Italy's president. It was an older video of Brazil's president at a Thanksgiving service.

Claim: Indian government will reduce employees’ pension by 30% and terminate pensions offered to those who are above 80 as a way to divert funds towards managing health services and tackling the adverse impact of the new coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: Indian Government has not issued any such order which states their intent to reduce employees pension by 30% and terminate pensions of those above the age of 80 in order to divert funds towards managing health services and tackle the adverse impact of the coronavirus pandemic in the country.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian government will reduce employees’ pension by 30% and terminate pensions offered to those who are above 80 as a way to divert funds towards managing health services and tackling the adverse impact of the new coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:Indian Government has not issued any such order which states their intent to reduce employees pension by 30% and terminate pensions of those above the age of 80 in order to divert funds towards managing health services and tackle the adverse impact of the coronavirus pandemic in the country.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/10/fact-check-the-indian-government-is-not-reducing-employees-pension-by-30/

Claim: Multiple news reports circulating in Nigeria claim that Buckingham Palace has announced Britain’s Queen Elizabeth tested positive for COVID-19.
Explaination: Although the Queen’s eldest son was diagnosed with the disease, the Palace said the monarch herself is “in good health”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Multiple news reports circulating in Nigeria claim that Buckingham Palace has announced Britain’s Queen Elizabeth tested positive for COVID-19.

Explanation:Although the Queen’s eldest son was diagnosed with the disease, the Palace said the monarch herself is “in good health”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/buckingham-palace-did-not-say-queen-tested-positive-coronavirus

Claim: A WhatsApp forward claims Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for a 14-hour long “Janta Curfew” on 3/22/20 from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. because the lifespan of the coronavirus in one place is only 12 hours and if we all follow the Janta Curfew religiously, then the chain will be broken
Explaination: There is no clear information on the lifespan of the novel coronavirus. However, various study reports have suggested a similar lifespan as that of other coronaviruses. PM Modi’s motive behind calling for a ‘Janta Curfew’ was just to curb the spreading of novel coronavirus and the Government has not claimed that the Janta Curfew is called to kill the virus hence the claim turned out to ‘Misleading’ in our fact-check.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A WhatsApp forward claims Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for a 14-hour long “Janta Curfew” on 3/22/20 from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. because the lifespan of the coronavirus in one place is only 12 hours and if we all follow the Janta Curfew religiously, then the chain will be broken

Explanation:There is no clear information on the lifespan of the novel coronavirus. However, various study reports have suggested a similar lifespan as that of other coronaviruses. PM Modi’s motive behind calling for a ‘Janta Curfew’ was just to curb the spreading of novel coronavirus and the Government has not claimed that the Janta Curfew is called to kill the virus hence the claim turned out to ‘Misleading’ in our fact-check.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15296110

Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts which claims to show the Koran being distributed to people in China after it lifted a “ban” on the Islamic holy text following the outbreak of the novel coronavirus, COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video has circulated online since at least 2013 in reports about people receiving copies of the Bible in China.
